[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Educational System (ES) helps users manage coursework, track progress, engage in learning, and access resources.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: ES supports content management, progress tracking, assessments, communication, virtual labs, and reports.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: ES integrates with learning management systems, student databases, grading tools, and virtual learning environments.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: ES provides a web and mobile UI for students, teachers, parents, and administrators.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: ES supports desktops, tablets, and smartphones.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: ES uses REST APIs, secure authentication, and cloud storage.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: ES provides notifications, messaging, and discussion forums.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: ES optimizes storage for student records, assignments, and performance data.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: ES manages courses, tracks progress, and supports assessments.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: ES customizes learning paths and resources based on student needs.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: ES connects with virtual labs, video conferencing, and online libraries.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: ES facilitates course management, student engagement, assessments, collaboration, and performance tracking.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: ES serves students, teachers, parents, and administrators.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: ES requires internet access for real-time updates and collaboration.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: ES relies on secure cloud storage, third-party learning platforms, and assessment tools.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Course Module: Set of lessons and tests.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall allow teachers to create and manage course content, including lectures, assignments, and assessments.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall provide students access to course materials, online discussions, and assessments.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-003: The system shall support integration with third-party educational tools, libraries, and assessment platforms.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall allow students to track their academic progress, grades, and assignments (REQ-INTF-001, REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall provide teachers with tools for student engagement, such as quizzes, interactive content, and discussion forums (REQ-INTF-002, REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall allow parents to monitor their child's progress, attendance, and communication with teachers.
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-004: The system shall provide administrators with reporting tools for student performance and engagement analytics.

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide a user-friendly UI for coursework and communication.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process student data, updates, and assessments within 2 seconds.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store student profiles, grades, assignments, discussion logs, and attendance records.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall support secure data encryption for student information.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with educational privacy laws and accessibility standards.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall ensure secure authentication and encrypted data storage.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Tests validate course management, student tracking, assessments, and communication tools.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User guides, API documentation, and compliance guidelines.
[SEC] 5. References: Educational standards, accessibility requirements, and data privacy policies.
